tit.e: Kitakinki Tango Railway Corporation Co., Ltd.
Kitakinki Tango Railway Corporation Co., Ltd.
Kitakinki Tango Railway Corporation Co., Ltd.

sen.j: 北近畿タンゴ鉄道株式会社（きたきんきたんごてつどう）は京都府で旧日本鉄道建設公団が建設した北近畿タンゴ鉄道宮福線と、旧国鉄特定地方交通線の鉄道路線北近畿タンゴ鉄道宮津線を運営している京都府などが出資する第三セクター会社である。
sen.e: Kitakinki Tango Tetsudo Kabushiki-gaisya is a public-private joint venture, located in and considerably financed by Kyoto Prefecture, operating both Miyafuku Line and Miyazu Line (the former was laid by Japan Railway Construction Public Corporation, and the latter was once designated as Specified Local Line of JNR).
sen.cmt: 次の文章との関係からここでは「北近畿タンゴ鉄道株式会社」はローマ字表記にしました。
sen.e: Kitakinki Tango Tetsudo Kabushiki-gaisya is a public-private joint venture, located in and considerably financed by Kyoto Prefecture, operating both the Miyafuku Line and Miyazu Line (the former was laid by Japan Railway Construction Public Corporation, and the latter was once designated as Specified Local Line of JNR).

Kitakinki Tango Tetsudo Kabushiki-gaisha is a public-private joint venture, located in and part financed by Kyoto Prefecture, operating both the Miyafuku Line and Miyazu Line (the former was laid by the Japan Railway Construction Public Corporation, and the latter was once designated as a Specified Local Line of the Japanese National Railways (JNR)).
sen.cmt: While not grammatically wrong, "considerably financed by" sounds a little unnatural to me and the Japanese doesn't seem to say directly (or give any hint about) how much Kyoto Prefecture has invested.If my understanding is correct, I think something like "part financed" would be more appropriate.Also, "designated as Specified Local Line of JNR" doesn't seem very natural English to me.

sen.j: 英訳名はKitakinki tango Railway Corporation.で、その略称からKTRと呼ばれている。
sen.e: Its English translation is Kitakinki Tango Railway Corporation Co., Ltd, called KTR for short.
sen.cmt: .オリジナルのスペリングは「タンゴ」の冒頭が小文字になっている等、誤りがあるように思いますので思い切って変えています。
sen.e: Its English translation is Kitakinki Tango Railway Corporation Co., Ltd, or KTR for short.
Its English translation is Kitakinki Tango Railway Corporation Co., Ltd, or KTR for short.

sen.j: 本社は京都府福知山市天田118番地の1（JR西日本ビル5階）、鉄道事業本部は京都府宮津市鶴賀2065番地の4（宮津駅2階）にある。
sen.e: The head office is located at 118-1, Amada, Fukuchiyama City, Kyoto Prefecture (the fifth floor of JR West Building), and the administrative office of the railway business is located at 2065-4, Tsuruga, Miyazu City, Kyoto Prefecture (the second floor of Miyazu Station).

Head office is located at 118-1, Amada, Fukuchiyama City, Kyoto Prefecture (the fifth floor of JR West Building), and the administrative office of the railway business is located at 2065-4, Tsuruga, Miyazu City, Kyoto Prefecture (the second floor of Miyazu Station).

Its head office is located at 118-1, Amada, Fukuchiyama City, Kyoto Prefecture (the fifth floor of JR West Building), and the administrative office of the railway business is located at 2065-4, Tsuruga, Miyazu City, Kyoto Prefecture (the second floor of Miyazu Station).
sen.cmt: I agree that "The head office" doesn't sound right, but wouldn't "Its head office" be better? "Head office is…" alone doesn't seem grammatically correct to me.

sen.j: 社名のタンゴとは、路線の所在する地域の令制国である丹後国に由来し、音楽のタンゴにも掛けたものである。
sen.e: Tango in the corporate name originates from the line's running area once called Tango province, which was a former Japanese administrative district based on the legal codes called ritsuryo in the Nara and Heian periods, and has the second meaning of the dance music, tango, as a wordplay.
sen.cmt: 「令制国」は、やや説明を要するタームであり、「律令という奈良・平安時代の法典に基づいて設置された、かつての日本の地方行政区分」とまとめてみました（'formally a Japanese administrative district based on the legal codes called ritsuryo in the Nara and Heian periods.'部分）。
sen.e: The word "Tango" in the corporate name originates from the name of the area the line operated in, the Tango province, which was formally a Japanese administrative district based on the legal codes called ritsuryo in the Nara and Heian periods. It is also a word play on the dance music, tango.
sen.cmt: Restructured sentence to flow more naturally.
sen.e: The word "Tango" in the corporate name originates from the name of the area the line operated in, the Tango Province, which was formerly a Japanese administrative district based on the legal codes called ritsuryo in the Nara and Heian periods; it is also a word play on the dance music, tango.
sen.cmt: Your rewrite reads much more naturally but I think "formally" should be "formerly", shouldn't it?

sen.j: 同社は1990年度から多額の赤字を計上しているが、新製した特急用車両の減価償却にともなうものである。
sen.e: The company has been in the red massively since fiscal year 1990 because of its depreciation of the newly manufactured rolling stock for limited expresses.
The company has been in the red massively since fiscal year 1990 because of its depreciation of the newly manufactured rolling stock for Limited Expresses.
sen.cmt: Changed to capitals on Limited Express, as it is a noun.
sen.e: The company has been in the red massively since fiscal year 1990 because of its depreciation of the newly manufactured rolling stock for limited expresses.
sen.cmt: I'm not sure you need to capitalize "limited express" on the basis that it's a noun (after all, so is "rolling stock").

sen.j: 歴史
sen.e: History
History
History

sen.j: 1982年（昭和57年）9月22日：宮福鉄道株式会社として設立。
sen.e: September 22, 1982-The company was founded as Miyafuku Railway Corporation.
sen.cmt: オリジナルでは日付の後にコロンが使われていますが、これは英文における正式なコロンの使い方とは異なるように思いますので、英訳に当たっては便宜上、ハイフンを使わせて頂きます。
sen.e: September 22, 1982-The company was founded as Miyafuku Railway Corporation.
September 22, 1982: Company founded as Miyafuku Railway Corporation.
sen.cmt: This kind of information is usually presented in a more abbreviated form, I think, such as the example to the left.

sen.j: 1988年（昭和63年）7月16日：宮福線開業。
sen.e: July 16, 1988-Miyafuku Line was opened.
July 16, 1988-Miyafuku Line was opened.
July 16, 1988: Miyafuku Line opened.
sen.cmt: This kind of information is usually presented in a more abbreviated form, I think, such as the example to the left.

sen.j: 1989年（平成元年）8月1日：JR宮津線の引継ぎに備え北近畿タンゴ鉄道株式会社に社名変更。
sen.e: August 1, 1989-The company was renamed Kitakinki Tango Railway Corporation Co., Ltd. in preparation for taking over JR Miyazu Line.
August 1, 1989-The company was renamed Kitakinki Tango Railway Corporation Co., Ltd. in preparation for taking over JR Miyazu Line.
August 1, 1989: Company renamed Kitakinki Tango Railway Corporation Co., Ltd. in preparation for takeover of JR Miyazu Line.
sen.cmt: This kind of information is usually presented in a more abbreviated form, I think, such as the example to the left.

sen.j: 1990年（平成2年）4月1日：JR宮津線を引継ぎ宮津線開業。
sen.e: April 1, 1990-The company took over JR Miyazu Line and renewed it as KTR Miyazu Line.
April 1, 1990-The company took over JR Miyazu Line and renamed it as KTR Miyazu Line.
sen.cmt: Need to confirm meaning of 引継ぎ. In the context of this sentence, "renamed" seems the best interpretation.
sen.e: April 1, 1990: Company took over JR Miyazu Line and renamed it as KTR Miyazu Line.
sen.cmt: Thank you for looking for more than just grammar mistakes.

sen.j: 特急「タンゴエクスプローラー」運転開始。
sen.e: And the company began the services of Limited Express 'Tango Explorer.'
'Tango Explorer' Limited Express service commenced.
sen.cmt: Please advise on whether to use "began" or "commenced". Please note, space added before first letter so that ' is displayed in Excel.
sen.e: Limited Express 'Tango Explorer' service commenced.
sen.cmt: 特急の表現を統一しました。

sen.j: 1996年（平成8年）3月16日：宮福線、宮津線宮津～天橋立間が電化開業。
sen.e: March 16, 1996-The company electrified and reopened the entire Miyafuku Line and a part of Miyazu Line from Miyazu Station to Amanohashidate Station.
March 16, 1996-The company electrified and reopened the entire Miyafuku Line and a part of Miyazu Line from Miyazu Station to Amanohashidate Station.
March 16, 1996: Company electrified and reopened the entire Miyafuku Line and a part of Miyazu Line from Miyazu Station to Amanohashidate Station.

sen.j: 特急「タンゴディスカバリー」運転開始。
sen.e: And it began the operation of the services of Limited Express 'Tango Discovery'
Tango Explorer' Limited Express service commenced.
sen.cmt: Please advise on whether to use "began" or "commenced". Please note, space added before first letter so that ' is displayed in Excel.
sen.e: Limited Express 'Tango Explorer' service commenced.
sen.cmt: 特急の表現を統一しました。

sen.j: 特急「はしだて」「文殊」の直通運転開始。
sen.e: It also began the direct driving of the services of Limited Express 'Hashidate' and 'Monjyu.'
It also began the direct driving of the services of Limited Express 'Hashidate' and 'Monjyu.'
sen.cmt: Need better description for 直通運転
sen.e: It also began the direct driving of the services of Limited Express 'Hashidate' and 'Monju.'

sen.j: 1999年（平成11年）10月2日：JR舞鶴線の電化開業にともない、「タンゴエクスプローラー」と「タンゴディスカバリー」の系統振替え。
sen.e: October 2, 1999-The company interchanged the driving system of 'Tango Explorer' with that of 'Tango Discovery' in accord with the electrification and reopening of JR Maizuru Line.
October 2, 1999-The company interchanged the driving system of 'Tango Explorer' with that of 'Tango Discovery' in accordance with the electrification and reopening of JR Maizuru Line.
October 2, 1999: Company interchanged the driving system of 'Tango Explorer' with that of 'Tango Discovery' in accordance with the electrification and reopening of JR Maizuru Line.

sen.j: 2007年（平成19年）9月1日：本社を京都市上京区の京都府庁舎西別館から福知山市天田のJR西日本ビル（西日本旅客鉄道福知山支社内）に移転。
sen.e: September 1, 2007-The company moved its headquarters from West Annex of Kyoto Prefectural Office in Kamigyo Ward, Kyoto Prefecture, to JR West Building (West Japan Railway Company Fukuchiyama Branch) at Amada, Fukuchiyama City, Kyoto Prefecture.

September 1, 2007-The company moved its headquarters from the West Annex of Kyoto Prefectural Office in Kamigyo Ward, Kyoto Prefecture, to JR West Building (West Japan Railway Company Fukuchiyama Branch) at Amada, Fukuchiyama City, Kyoto Prefecture.

September 1, 2007: Company moved its headquarters from the West Annex of Kyoto Prefectural Office in Kamigyo Ward, Kyoto City, to JR West Building (West Japan Railway Company Fukuchiyama Branch) at Amada, Fukuchiyama City, Kyoto Prefecture.
sen.cmt: Company, Kyoto City としました。

sen.e: Railway
Railway
Railway

sen.j: 北近畿タンゴ鉄道宮福線 宮津～福知山 30.4km
sen.e: KTR Miyafuku Line: Miyazu Station--Fukuchiyama Station; totaling up to 30.4km in its distance.
KTR Miyafuku Line: Miyazu Station--Fukuchiyama Station; totaling up to 30.4km in idistance.
KTR Miyafuku Line: between Miyazu Station and Fukuchiyama Station; totaling up to 30.4 km in distance.
sen.cmt: km 前のスペースを追加しました。

sen.j: 北近畿タンゴ鉄道宮津線 西舞鶴～豊岡 83.6km
sen.e: KTR Miyazu Line: Nishi-Maizuru Station--Toyo'oka Station; totaling up to 83.6km in its distance.
KTR Miyazu Line: Nishi-Maizuru Station--Toyo'oka Station; totaling up to 83.6km in distance.
KTR Miyazu Line: between Nishi-Maizuru Station and Toyooka Station; totaling up to 83.6 km in distance.

sen.j: 車両
sen.e: Rolling stock
Rolling stock
Rolling stock

sen.j: 自社保有車両はすべて気動車で富士重工業（2003年に新潟トランシスへ鉄道車両製造事業等を譲渡）製である。
sen.e: The whole rolling stock owned by KTR is diesel cars, and was manufactured in Fuji Heavy Industries Ltd, whose rolling stock manufacturing business and others were transferred to Niigata Transys Co.,Ltd. in 2003.
All rolling stock owned by KTR are diesel cars manufactured in Fuji Heavy Industries Ltd, whose rolling stock manufacturing business and others were transferred to Niigata Transys Co., Ltd. in 2003.
sen.cmt: Restructured to sound more natural. Please check that tense "are" is correct (meaning they still are Fuji diesel engines). The であるat the end suggests this is the case, but as this is a historic article, this may be wrong.
sen.e: All rolling stock owned by KTR are diesel cars manufactured in Fuji Heavy Industries Ltd, whose rolling stock manufacturing business and others were transferred to Niigata Transys Co., Ltd. in 2003.

sen.j: 宮福線全線と宮津線の天橋立～宮津間が電化されているが、電車は保有していない。
sen.e: The entire Miyafuku Line and a part of Miyazu Line from Amanohashidate Station to Miyazu Station are electrified, but the corporation has no electric train.
The entire Miyafuku Line and a part of Miyazu Line from Amanohashidate Station to Miyazu Station are electrified, but the corporation has no electric train.
The entire Miyafuku Line and a part of Miyazu Line from Amanohashidate Station to Miyazu Station are electrified, but the corporation has no electric train.

sen.j: 電化されている区間には国鉄183系電車などの西日本旅客鉄道（JR西日本）保有車両が乗り入れている。
sen.e: In the electrified section, the KTR track is shared by the rolling stock of West Japan Railway Company (JR West), such as the JNR Limited Express Series 183.
In the electrified section, the KTR track is shared by the rolling stock of West Japan Railway Company (JR West), such as the JNR Limited Express Series 183.
In the electrified section, the KTR track is shared by the rolling stock of West Japan Railway Company (JR West), such as the JNR Limited Express Series 183.

sen.cmt: 「国鉄キハ65形」はそのものズバリの英訳はみつけられなかったものの、次の文章の「国鉄キハ58系気動車」の出典と同一のアドレスに類似車両として紹介されています。ゆえにその「58系」の部分のみ「65形」に変えて英訳しています。

sen.j: 国鉄キハ58系気動車（急行「丹後」・急行「みやづ」・急行「はしだて」 ワンマン車「4都市循環列車」また借り入れ車として普通列車の増結運用。
sen.e: JNR/JR Diesel Cars Series Kiha 58 (This was operated as Express 'Tango,' Express 'Miyazu,' Express 'Hashidate,' 'Circulation Train around 4 Cities' without a conductor, or the rolling stock linked with local trains for their assistance.
sen.cmt: 1.「四都市循環列車」について、「循環列車」（Circulation Train) の部分だけは app.korail.go.kr/ROOT/cambo-view.cambo?... に記述があります。 2.「増結運用」とは、「連結して運用すること」ですので、説明的になりますが、'the rolling stock linked with local trains for their assistance'のように訳しました。
sen.e: JNR/JR Diesel Cars Series Kiha 58 (This was operated as Express 'Tango,' Express 'Miyazu,' Express 'Hashidate,' 'Intercity Train around 4 Cities' without a conductor, or the rolling stock linked with local trains for their assistance.

JNR/JR Diesel Cars Series Kiha 58 (This was operated as Express 'Tango,' Express 'Miyazu,' Express 'Hashidate,' 'Intercity Train around Four Cities' without a conductor, or the rolling stock linked with local trains for their assistance.
sen.cmt: 数字をスペルアウトしました。

sen.j: 臨時列車・団体列車としても運用）
sen.e: It was also operated as the special train or the group passengers' train.)
It was also operated as a substitute or temporary train, or for group trips)
sen.cmt: 臨時列車can have multiple meanings in English, but to clarify this sentence I believe it is best to use two words, "Substitute" and "Temporary". Although "Substitute" is not a direct translation from 臨時列車, it is common knowledge that trains of this type are used in this way.
sen.e: It was also operated as a substitute or temporary train, or for group trips)

Fare and charge
Fare and charge

sen.j: 大人普通旅客運賃（小児半額・10円未満切り上げ）。
sen.e: Ordinary fare for an adult (it's half and rounded up under ¥10 for an infant)
Ordinary fare for an adult (infant fare is half price, rounded up to nearest ¥10)
Ordinary fare for an adult (fare for a child is half price, rounded up to nearest ten yen)
sen.cmt: infant ではなく、child ではないかと思います。

sen.j: 2007年4月1日現在。
sen.e: The list below is the fare as of April 1, 2007.
The list below is the fare as of April 1, 2007.
The list below is the fare as of April 1, 2007.

sen.j: 大人特急料金（小児半額・10円未満切り上げ）。
sen.e: Limited express charge for an adult (it's half and rounded up under ¥10 for an infant)
Limited Express fare for an adult (infant fare is half price, rounded up to nearest ¥10)
sen.cmt: Capitals on Limited Express, as it is a Noun. Restructure.
sen.e: Limited Express fare for an adult (fare for a child is half price, rounded up to nearest ten yen)
sen.cmt: infant ではなく、child ではないかと思います。

sen.j: 2007年4月1日現在。
sen.e: The list below is the charge as of April 1, 2007.
The list below is the charge as of April 1, 2007.
The list below is the charge as of April 1, 2007.

sen.j: 特急列車の普通車を利用の場合は乗車券・特急券が必要。
sen.e: When getting on an ordinary car of a limited express, you have to buy a basic ticket and a limited express ticket.
When getting on an ordinary car of a limited express, you have to buy a basic ticket and a limited express ticket.
sen.cmt: Capitals on Limited Express, as it is a Noun. Restructure.
sen.e: When getting on an ordinary car of a limited express, you have to buy a basic ticket and a limited express ticket.

sen.j: 大人グリーン料金（小児同額）。
sen.e: Green Car charge for an adult (it's the same for an infant)
Green Car charge for an adult (it's the same for an infant)
Green Car charge for an adult (it's the same for an child)
sen.cmt: infant ではなく、child ではないかと思います。

sen.j: 2007年4月1日現在。
sen.e: The list below is the charge as of April 1, 2007.
The list below is the charge as of April 1, 2007.
The list below is the charge as of April 1, 2007.

sen.j: 特急列車のグリーン車を利用の場合は乗車券・指定席特急券（この場合の料金は自由席特急券と同額）・グリーン券が必要。
sen.e: When getting on the Green Car of a limited express, you have to buy a basic ticket, a limited express ticket for a reserved seat (this ticket costs the same as the limited express ticket for a non-reserved seat of the Shinkansen) and also, a Green ticket.

When getting on the Green Car of a Limited Express, you have to buy a basic ticket, a Limited Express ticket for a reserved seat (this ticket costs the same as the Limited Express ticket for a non-reserved seat on the Shinkansen) and also, a Green ticket.

When getting on the Green Car of a limited express, you have to buy a basic ticket, a limited express ticket for a reserved seat (this ticket costs the same as the limited express ticket for a non-reserved seat on the Shinkansen) and also, a Green ticket.
sen.cmt: limited express 小文字にしました。
